programme.title: Pup Star: World Tour
programme.desc: Pup Star is back and bigger than ever as the hit singing-pup competition show goes global! After achieving international stardom, Tiny the adorable Yorkie joins the celebrity judges for the first-ever Pup Star World Tour. The judges each welcome their favourite contestant from around the world to the Pup Star pack, training them to compete for the new title of global pup star champion. India's Raji joins Team Growl, China's Ming joins Team Paw-Paw, Nigeria's Mobo joins Team Gnarley, and Mexico's dashing telenovela star Julio joins Team Tiny.

programme.title: Love Wrecked
programme.desc: Jenny Taylor (Amanda Bynes) has found her ideal man who she just knows would sweep her off her feet. The only problem? He's Jason Masters (Chris Carmack), the world's biggest rock star. Hoping for a chance to get close to her idol, Jenny takes a job in his favourite Caribbean resort with her best friend Ryan (Jonathan Bennett). When Jason is washed overboard in a storm, Jenny jumps in to save him and the pair find themselves stranded on a seemingly-deserted tropical island.

programme.title: MXP: Most Xtreme Primate
programme.desc: After an exciting career playing professional hockey and busting tricks with the world’s best skateboarders, Jack is back at the El Simian nature preserve. Jack likes hanging around but soon he grows tired of life at the preserve. Trying to liven things up, Julie, the caretaker, organizes a family vacation to Mexico. But then, Jack gets separated from the group and ends up on the wrong plane to Colorado!! Lost and confused, Jack meets up with Pete, a snowboarder, and his rocker brother Jay, who try to help Jack find his family.

programme.title: Walk of Shame
programme.desc: After losing an audition for her dream job, Meghan Miles, a Los Angeles TV news anchor, goes out for an uncharacteristic night of partying. She awakes in a stranger’s bed to a phone message announcing the job is hers, if she can make it to the news station by time of broadcast. Stranded in an unknown area without money, a phone, and a car, Meghan — clad in a provocative yellow dress — embarks on a series of misadventures. As she races to the most important job interview of her life, she finds herself among drug dealers and hookers — all while being pursued by the LAPD, an angry taxi driver, and a young kid with an attitude.

programme.title: Frat Pack
programme.desc: A shy British graduate gets dragged on a wild road trip across America to a fraternity party by his soon-to-be stepbrothers, as his mother marries into a larger-than-life, American family. This raucous and wild comedy from Michael Philip (Drop Dead Sexy, Van Wilder 2, Timber Falls) stars Danny Trejo (Machete), Melissa Bolona (Acts of Violence, The Hurricane Heist) and Hana Mae Lee (Pitch Perfect).

programme.title: My Art
programme.desc: Ellie Shine (Laurie Simmons) is a single artist living in New York City. Ellie has a good life: a stable teaching job, successful friends, and a loyal, aging dog named Bing. As her decades-old dream of a respectable place in the art world becomes more elusive, her frustration with her lack of recognition feels alarmingly urgent. When she is offered the summer house and studio of a famous friend she seizes the opportunity to hit the reset button on her life and work. She unwittingly finds inspiration in two out-of-work actors who maintain the gardens at her summer retreat.

programme.title: UAE Warriors 9
programme.desc: UAE Warriors 9 brings to you live action from Mubadala Arena in Abu Dhabi on November 29th, 2019. The 15-fight card is headlined by a lightweight bout between UFC veterans Dan Moret and Anton Kuivanen. In the co-headliner, Steven Kennedy faces Tarek Suleiman. In the lightweight division, undefeated Russian Usman Nurmagomedov has been matched with Ukraine’s Roman Golovinov. Meanwhile in the middleweight division ONE Championship alumni Bakhtiyar Abbasov has been matched with Igor Litoshik and Ahmad Labban faces Magomedsultan Magomedsultanov.

programme.title: Fishing TV Show - Lures from the Shores
programme.desc: Host Rae Borras is rock hopping the Dorset coast with Jansen Teakle, casting lures for Sea Bass. Chilly is on the River Ebro in Spain after Catfish, but also nabbing the odd monster Carp. Steve Collett's got some top tips for plumbing the depth and Nick Hart fishes small still waters. Finally Duncan Charman pays a winter visit to the River Itchen and trots for Grayling.

programme.title: Fishing TV Show - Chalk Stream Grayling
programme.desc: Host Rae Borras teams up with top fly fisherman Steve Cullen on Hampshire's river Anton for a spot of Grayling fishing. Ian Chillcott swaps his fixed spool reels for centrepins as he targets river carp at the start of a new season. David Chidzoy has a handy beachcasting tip and we join Duncan Charman on a session, fishing for big summer eels.

programme.title: Fishing TV Show - Avington Trout Return
programme.desc: Presenters Ian Chillcott and Rae Borras return to the crystal clear lakes at Avington Trout Fishery in Hampshire, where Chilly is determined to put his new found casting skills to the test. Des Taylor is following the latest trend, drop shotting for Perch around the moorings on his local stretch of canal. Adam Penning recommends sweetcorn as the must use bait in winter. Chilly also has early morning success whilst carp fishing in Essex and Dave Barham is catching some Mackerel live bait ready for a day's Sea Bass fishing.

programme.title: Fishing TV Show - Short Session Carping
programme.desc: Host Ian Chillcott joins Adam Penning to share tactics for short session fishing for carp, at Blasford Hill Fishery near Chelmsford. Meanwhile Julian Chidgey heads out into Falmouth Bay fishing for Bass on light lures. Rob Wooton has a quick tip for casting your waggler float into the current and Duncan Charman targets big roach and shows how to make the most of their feeding times.

programme.title: The Bugatti Chronicles
programme.desc: A documentary about the life of Ettore Bugatti, the automobile manufacturer. Bugatti means luxury, speed, elegance. Despites its Italian patronym it’s also a French brand implanted in the heart of Alsace, in Molsheim.

programme.title: Black September: Munich Olympics 1972
programme.desc: At dawn, on the 11th day of the XX Olympic Games in Munich, in 1972, 8 Palestinians of the terrorist group Black September climb over the fence surrounding the Olympic village. They head towards the Israeli team’s quarter. What happens thereafter is history: eleven Israeli athletes, one German policeman and five terrorists die in a bloodbath. The Munich massacre not only shocks the whole world but also launches a new era of international terrorism. This intense and gripping film provides entirely new perspectives and insights into this traumatizing event with never-before-seen footage of the victims and of the negotiations with the terrorists.

programme.title: Fishing TV Show - Day Ticket Carping
programme.desc: Example

programme.title: Fishing TV Show - Stillwater Roach
programme.desc: Host Rae Borras teams up with top specimen angler Duncan Charman who promises to get him in to some big Roach during a session at Mill Farm Fishery in Sussex. Dave Barham and Jim Midgley are boatfishing off Anglesey hoping to catch some smoothhound and Ian Chillcott meets up with David Burgess keeper at the famous Royalty Fishery on the Hampshire Avon, where he fishes for carp but catches a 10lb+ Barbel!

programme.title: Saving Warru
programme.desc: Warru, or black-footed rock-wallaby, is one of South Australia's most endangered mammals. In 2007, when numbers dropped below 200 in the remote north-west of the State, the Warru Recovery Team was formed to help save the precious species from extinction. Bringing together contemporary science, practical on-ground threat management and traditional Anangu ecological knowledge, this unique decade-long program has recently celebrated the release of dozens of warru to the wild for the first time.

programme.title: Traceable
programme.desc: In a world filled with throw-away fashion, emerging designer Laura Siegel’s dream is to shift the perspectives of consumers and connect them to the hands that craft her garments. Follow this idealistic designer as she travels across India to produce her collection. But will positioning her collection in the sustainable domain enable her to survive in the highly competitive fashion industry?

programme.title: Circus in the Sky
programme.desc: Birds of prey make some of the most impressive appearances in the sky. But eagles and hawks aren’t the typical hunters circling around fields: kites and harriers are the most fascinating. With acrobatic aerial plays, they look for partners. And sliding calmly over open areas, they go hunting. Human-made landscape changes, and hence declining numbers of mice and hamsters, put their mesmerizing aerial performances at risk. Yet, thanks to remarkable adaptability, they are once again on the ascent.

programme.title: The CRISPR Revolution - Genome Editing
programme.desc: Is it the latest gene scandal or a blessing for medicine and agriculture? CRISPR allows scientists to change the genetic material of all living organisms. Researchers are developing therapies for incurable diseases plants with new characteristics are being created. But the designer baby is also within reach. How far should medicine or agriculture be allowed to go? Researchers, ethicists and critics do agree: society urgently needs to debate the chances and boundaries of genetic engineering.

programme.title: Greeks of the Sea | Season 1 | Episode 2
programme.desc: In Naxos, Nikos meets the flamboyant local harbour master and a billionaire property tycoon with a magnificent cruiser. He tries his hand at windsurfing and spends a crazy 24-hours on the party island of Ios.

programme.title: Karun
programme.desc: Karun: Misadventures On Iran’s Longest River' - British adventurers Tom Allen and Leon McCarron set out to follow Iran’s longest river, the Karun, by human powered means. Their aim is to go beyond the politics and explore the culture and geography of this most misunderstood of nations and have a great adventure doing so. But despite Tom’s previous experience of travel in Iran, they find that cultural differences run deeper than they’d realised.

programme.title: Aina
programme.desc: ‘ĀINA: That Which Feeds Us’ – The best-kept secret on Kaua`i isn’t a secluded beach or local surf spot, it’s that four of the world’s largest chemical companies are using the island as an open-air testing ground for pesticides on genetically modified crops. Winner Accolades Global Film Competition.

programme.title: Ancient Grains - Quinoa
programme.desc: When you open your pantry, do images of the rugged mountains of South America, the colorful tablelands of Africa and the fertile river valleys of the Middle East dance before your eyes? If not, you have yet to discover amaranth, quinoa, spelt, kamut and teff, the quintet of nutritional powerhouses known as the ancient grains. The legends behind their origins many millennia past, their loss over time and their ultimate modern revival - literally tell the story of civilization.

programme.title: Wadjemup : Black Prison White Playground
programme.desc: Black Prison White Playground. Wadjemup/Rottnest Island. A beautiful place that is culturally and spiritually significant to Aboriginal people. And also a site where gross harm took place and hundreds of Aboriginal men are buried in unmarked graves.

programme.title: Letters to our Children: Stories of Refuge
programme.desc: A group of immigrant and refugee mothers from 10 different countries and speaking different languages create a book of illustrations showcasing heartfelt letters to their children as a way to explain what brought them to Winnipeg, Canada and what they hope their lives will be like. This film follows the women’s incredible journey as they find a way to pass their stories to their children.

programme.title: Amazonas
programme.desc: Numerous climatic, political and civilising changes have a great impact on the settlements in the central Amazon area. Step by step the local people develop their own mentality regarding a sustainable and well-adapted life in the heart of the Amazon rain forests. In 2012, the film maker Thomas Miklautsch from Carinthia, together with his assistant Anja Krois, set off to travel for several months along the Amazon, from the Columbian Leticia to Rio Ampiyaco near Iquitos in Peru, always in harmony

programme.title: Break Point: a Davis Cup Story
programme.desc: Led by Rafa Nadal, the Spanish team were this year’s favourite until they suffered a serious setback. The team’s number two player, Roberto Bautista, had to leave the competition for his hometown to be at his father´s side during the last hours of his life. Without Bautista, Nadal and Feliciano López heroically managed to lead the team into the final. But then came the news that thrilled tennis fans worldwide: Bautista is coming back to the competition after his father´s funeral, and he´s ready to play. United again, the members of the Spanish team fight for victory in the grand final, where something far beyond tennis is at stake.

programme.title: SEVE - Artist, Fighter, Legend
programme.desc: Seve Ballesteros was an artist, a golfing Picasso. He was a fighter against back injury, rivals on the golf course, a disintegrating swing, and finally cancer. He remains a legend, a multi-major champion and the man who made the modern Ryder Cup. This is his story, from members of his inner circle, other sporting greats and from himself via newly unearthed material.

programme.title: Ride Your Dream
programme.desc: Motorcycling was a man’s world, until now. This documentary introduces us to Ana Carrasco, the Spanish rider who has revolutionised the two wheels’ world and who, from an early age, had a clear dream: being world champion. Through intimate conversations with her family and team, we get to know Ana’s motivations, the obstacles she has faced and the dreams she keeps chasing. Her career, from its origins in a small town in Murcia to being the first woman to win the World Championship, is a source of inspiration for anyone. Ana herself is a clear example of overcoming struggle and tenacity, and her story which is full of exciting moments encourages us all to fight for our dreams.

programme.title: Made in Senegal
programme.desc: Made in Senegal is a story about will, dreams, determination, faith, rebellion, courage and love. The film invites us on a journey through Sadio´s different and highly diverse worlds - from the rural life in a small village in the far south of Senegal to the spotlight of world football by playing for Liverpool FC, even winning the Champions Leagues as number 10 with the world watching… The interaction of animations, documentary scenes, a diverse set of in-depth interviews and archive footage brings Sadio´s past to life and creates an exciting and emotional plot.

programme.title: BVB 09 Stories - Who we are: Uprooting (Episode 3)
programme.desc: After the initial games, the First Eleven is established where the next generation of footballers may end up playing a crucial role for BVB. While Giovanni Reyna has already had a breakthrough into the pro team, the even younger Youssoufa Moukoko works on his debut. How do these two exceptional teenagers cope with the challenges of being in the public eye from a young early? This episode takes a close look into the challenges of talent promotion and social responsibility.

programme.title: BVB 09 Stories - Who we are: The Greed for Success (Episode 4)
programme.desc: When Erling Haaland signed with BVB it created a huge media stir. A year on, he is due a review of his outstanding first and record-breaking year at Dortmund. However, for Haaland, there has been more to this last year than just being on the pitch, such as, how has he grown as a player and a person? How do friends, companions and his father perceive his development? Is there any unnoticed potential concerning his career? Narrated by Haaland himself along with his closest advisor, his father, Alfie, this episode is a truly personal story.

programme.title: BVB 09 Stories - Who we are: Never forget (Episode 5)
programme.desc: In January, focus is on commemorating the atrocities committed by the Nazis. BVB is doing commemorative work and wants to preserve this for future generations. The episode is set in the former Auschwitz concentration camp in present-day Poland. Holocaust survivor Eva Szepesi and others share their stories, contributing to the importance of remembering these events and emphasising the social responsibility of football.

programme.title: BVB 09 Stories - Who we are: Real Love (Episode 6)
programme.desc: “Echte liebe”. A brand claim or much more? Mats Hummels talks about the old and new times at Dortmund. Norbert Dickel meets Dede, and Jürgen Klopp remembers an almost perfect championship team. In addition, former talent Dario Scuderi tells his incredible story that will forever connect him to BVB.

programme.title: Anything is Possible
programme.desc: Serge Ibaka grew up poor and at times homeless in the streets of Brazzaville. His mom died when he was 7. His dad was in prison when he was 12. Despite these overwhelming obstaces he achieved his dream of becoming an NBA Champion. This documentary follows Serge on his journey home to the Republic of Congo, to show them the NBA Championship trophy but more importantly he shares a message that through hard work and determination, "Anything is Possible"!

programme.title: Secrets of the Universe
programme.desc: There is a rare class of volcanic eruptions that marshal the energy that lurks, like a sleeping dragon, beneath the surface of planet Earth. Reach back 70 thousand years to the island of Sumatra, when Earth’s crust literally collapsed, initiating one of the largest single eruptions known. Fly down to the mother of all eruptions, 250 million years ago, when the infamous Siberian Traps set in motion the largest mass extinction in Earth’s history. Move beyond Earth to explore the impact of giant volcanic eruptions around our solar system, on Neptune's frigid moon Triton, and the ultimate volcanic realm: Jupiter's moon Io. On a visit to a legendary North American hot spot, Yellowstone National Park, the film asks: can a supervolcano erupt in our time?

programme.title: Hitler's Mein Kampf: A Dangerous Book
programme.desc: In 2016, 70 years after the death of his author, Mein Kampf entered into the public domain. Several questions arise with it: why does the book remain so dangerous? Why do Hitler’s thoughts remain so fascinating?

programme.title: Tokyo Toy Guy
programme.desc: "Tokyo Toy Guy" is a Story of one passionate Vintage Batman Toy collector visiting world's top Batman Collectors around the world, from Manchester to Singapore. Revealing the most anticipated memorabilia of all time. Finding out the history of Batman toys mainly from 1940s to 1970s.

programme.title: Aliens: Are We Alone?
programme.desc: Does alien life exist out there in the Universe? Scientists are now getting closer than ever to answering that question thanks to the Kepler Space Telescope. This revolutionary spacecraft is on a mission to find habitable alien planets. Thanks to Kepler, we now know of thousands of possible planets and we’re getting closer than ever to finding the holy grail: a twin of our Earth. We use CGI to bring these alien worlds to life, and with the help of scientists, we speculate on what extra-terrestrial life might be like.

programme.title: James Bond: For Our Eyes Only
programme.desc: In 1953, James Bond first emerged as a character in Ian Fleming's novel ‘Casino Royale’, and just nine years later the spy was the protagonist in the film ‘Dr. No’ – thus starting one of the longest and most successful franchises in the history of cinema. Beautiful women, exhilarating stunts, breath-taking locales and the charm of a handsome English secret agent have formed the essential ingredients of all Bond films. Recount and relive all of 007’s menacing missions, from the first feature film production in 1962 to the highly anticipated ‘No Time To Die’.

programme.title: The Bay Games
programme.desc: Over 600 everyday athletes came together and competed in the country’s first ever functional fitness festival. Jervis Bay, NSW is home to The Bay Games, a two-day event that pushes these weekend warriors to their limits and beyond. Our cameras were there.

programme.title: Waking The Titanic
programme.desc: Waking the Titanic is something special, a living history told on a small, but no less poignant human scale. Through stylised re-enactments, the docudrama recreates the story of the Addergoole 14 and what happened to them on the Titanic. The story is told using detailed accounts handed down to family members from the people of the time and interviews with the descendents of 3 who survived.

programme.title: The Dinosaur Echo
programme.desc: The Dinosaur Echo is a documentary about the renaissance of paleontology in Canada today and what dinosaurs can teach us about climate change. The film introduces us to a new generation of paleontolgists who are making extraordinary dinosaur discoveries in Alberta and British Columbia in Canada. The Dinosaur Echo is directed, written and produced by Canadian filmmaker Brandy Yanchyk.

programme.desc: Full of hilarious scenarios, characters, dialogue, and consequences, this selection of shorts has it all. A range of international films are included but the humor remains universal.

programme.title: Family Drama
programme.desc: Dramatic stories with broader and sometimes more accessible themes for everyone, this collection of shorts includes everything from family comedy, and animation to heavier hitting, gritty storytelling.

programme.title: Emotional High
programme.desc: This collection of short films are intimate, powerful dramas that will leave a lasting emotional impact with their tender, strong, emotive, and sometimes tear-jerking themes

programme.title: German Corner
programme.desc: A range of stand-out short films in the German language showcasing original stories, deeply layered characters, and high-quality production values. Some highly relevant themes are explored in this selection.

programme.title: Period/Historical
programme.desc: A collection of short films set in different times throughout history, from the battlefields of WW2 to the streets of 1950s Mississippi, these are dramas and action stories that focus on the power of individual choice and the strength of humanity.

programme.title: Mothers with Problems
programme.desc: Mothers and the challenges they face are at the center of this dramatic selection. The perspectives shift in each film, with stories that explore mothers at the end of their tether, mothers who’ll do anything for their children, and mothers who struggle to understand their own offspring.

programme.title: Intimate Drama
programme.desc: A focus on character-driven stories that leave an emotional impact through quietly powerful storytelling, often with a deeper social or psychological message beneath the surface.

programme.title: Best of Sofy
programme.desc: A selection of the most compelling, highest quality, emotionally impactful, and award-winning shorts on Sofy TV, includes a range of all genres from all over the world.

programme.title: Action
programme.desc: An action-packed selection but not always of the high octane variety, here you will also find stories of adventure and conflict, suspense and drama, and some highly original narratives.

programme.title: Spinning Plates
programme.desc: Spinning Plates is a documentary about three extraordinary restaurants and the incredible people who make them what they are. A cutting-edge restaurant named the seventh-best in the world whose chef must battle a life-threatening obstacle to pursue his passion. A 150-year-old family restaurant still standing only because of the unbreakable bond with its community. A fledgling Mexican restaurant whose owners are risking everything just to survive and provide for their young daughter. Their unforgettable stories of family, legacy, passion and survival come together to reveal how meaningful food can be, and the power it has to connect us to one another.

programme.title: Te Ata
programme.desc: Te Ata (TAY' AH-TAH) is based on the inspiring, true story of Mary Thompson Fisher, a woman who traversed cultural barriers to become one of the greatest Native American performers of all time. Born in Indian Territory, and raised on the songs and stories of her Chickasaw tribe, Te Ata's journey to find her true calling led her through isolation, discovery, love and a stage career that culminated in performances for a United States president, European royalty and audiences across the world. Yet of all the stories she shared, none are more inspiring than her own.

programme.title: Love Me Like You Do
programme.desc: A modern day train hopper fighting to become a successful musician, and a single mom battling to maintain custody of her daughter, defy their circumstances by coming together in a relationship that may change each others lives forever.

programme.title: The Admiral: Command And Conquer
programme.desc: When the young republic of The Netherlands is attacked by the great Kingdom of England, France and Germany and the country itself is on the brink of civil war, only one man can lead the country's strongest weapon, the Dutch fleet: Michiel de Ruyter.

programme.title: Into the White
programme.desc: In World War II, the German pilots Lieutenant Horst Schopis, Josef Schwartz and Wolfgang Strunk crash their airplane in the wilderness of Norway after shooting down a British airplane. They walk through a snow storm until they reach shelter in an abandoned hunter cabin. Soon the British pilot Captain Charles P. Davenport and the gunner Robert Smith arrive in the cabin and they become prisoners of the German pilots. However, after the initial friction between the enemies, they realize that they should team-up to survive in the wilderness in the beginning of an improbable friendship.

programme.title: Across the Great Divide
programme.desc: Two orphans set out in 1876 to cross the Rocky Mountains to claim their inheritance - a ranch in Oregon.

programme.title: The Journey Home
programme.desc: In Northern Canada, a young boy defies nature to reunite an abandoned polar bear cub with its mother.

programme.title: Race to Space
programme.desc: Billy is delighted when he is chosen to help train Mac, a chimpanzee set to be hurled into space by NASA.

programme.title: Into the Sun
programme.desc: An Air Force pilot and a movie star learning about air combat are drawn into combat.

programme.title: Across the Great Divide
programme.desc: Two orphans set out in 1876 to cross the Rocky Mountains to claim their inheritance - a ranch in Oregon.

programme.title: The Dogfather
programme.desc: When a Mafia don's right-hand man, a bulldog named Sonny, swallows his ring, comedy ensues as two of the don's best soldiers try and retrieve the ring from Sonny, who has been adopted by a new family.

programme.title: Fatal Memories
programme.desc: Psychological thriller. A woman tries to help her sister remember the events surrounding the fatal stabbing of their mother.

programme.title: What Happened Last Night
programme.desc: Two college students, Danny and Sarah, are strangers until they wake up together after a night of partying. Told in reverse time order, the story follows what happened the night before.

programme.title: Anatomy of Deception
programme.desc: A district attorney who, tapped to replace the outgoing mayor, is stalked by a man who engineers her fall from grace, leading her to push back and beat him at his own game.

programme.title: Text To Kill
programme.desc: Teens band together to investigate the source of anonymous messages that threaten to expose their secrets.

programme.title: Editor's Pick
programme.desc: This collection has got the lot: new, old, and all those in-between. Animation, comedy, love, drama, action, they’re all included to ensure that whatever your streaming tastebuds desire, there’s something to satisfy those cravings.

programme.title: Family Ties
programme.desc: It is often said a family that plays together stays together. All it really means is a family that spends time together will have a close bond and a lasting relationship. Thus we’ve selected remarkably Family films that tug at your heart as long as you watch them with your family.

programme.title: Films By Her
programme.desc: Women’s films genre is one of the most visible genres in film criticism today and most dominant trend in cinemas lately.

programme.title: Drama
programme.desc: Our Drama films are serious, plot-driven presentations, portraying realistic characters, life situations and stories involving intense character development and interaction.

programme.title: Salt Beef & Rye
programme.desc: This vibrant documentary is inspired by the colourful characters who frequent the world famous Brick Lane. London's reputation as the cultural hub of the world can be attributed in part to its deep-rooted history and diverse communities. Salt Beef & Rye takes audiences on a tour through one of the city's most influential streets.

programme.title: The Sea Wolf Eps 1 of 2
programme.desc: The Sea Wolf is an engrossing psychological thriller based on the best-selling novel by Jack London. Tyrannical, brutal and notorious, Captain Wolf Larsen, AKA the infamous Sea Wolf (Sebastian Koch: Bridge of Spies) rules the crew of his seal-hunting schooner with an iron fist. A unique high-seas adventure that will stir, inspire, and excite like never before.

programme.title: The Sea Wolf Eps 2 of 2
programme.desc: The Sea Wolf is an engrossing psychological thriller based on the best-selling novel by Jack London. Tyrannical, brutal and notorious, Captain Wolf Larsen, AKA the infamous Sea Wolf (Sebastian Koch: Bridge of Spies) rules the crew of his seal-hunting schooner with an iron fist. A unique high-seas adventure that will stir, inspire, and excite like never before.

programme.title: Nothing But the Truth
programme.desc: A edge-of-your-seat political thriller starring Kate Beckinsale (Love & Friendship), Vera Farmiga (The Conjuring) and Matt Dillon (Crash). Washington DC political journalist Rachel Armstrong writes an explosive story about a government scandal revealing the name of a covert CIA agent. When a special government prosecutor demands she divulge her source, she refuses and struggles to defend herself.

programme.title: Into The White
programme.desc: The exceptional tale of when war took a back seat. Starring Rupert Grint (Harry Potter franchise), this heart-stopping, dramatic thriller is inspired by true events. Stranded in the wilderness of Norway after an aircraft battle, a group of German pilots reach an abandoned cabin. Followed shortly, by two British pilots. Now sheltering together for survival, will the soldiers put their enmity aside?

programme.title: Last Knights
programme.desc: Gladiator meets Game of Thrones in this electrifying epic starring Academy Award winner Morgan Freeman and Academy Award nominee Clive Owen. In an age of honour and justice by the sword Raiden is a fallen warrior who must rise up against a corrupt and sadistic ruler to avenge Bartok, his dishonoured master.

programme.title: Munki and Trunk - Season 1 - Episodes 7-9
programme.desc: Home Improvement | Is It A Monster | Hiccup Line Munki and Trunk is a tree-crashing, rock-smashing, water-splashing, fruit-mashing knockabout comedy adventure! Munki (a bold, banana-juggling adventurer) and Trunk (a big-hearted and optimistic elephant) are best friends. They do everything together - swinging, stomping and somersaulting as they explore their jungle world, hatching plans, solving problems, having fun and helping friends along the way.

programme.title: Love Me Like You Do
programme.desc: Ryan Brenner is a traveling musician, and Jackie Laurel is a fallen country music star who is a recently single mother, battling to hold on to her young daughter. When the free-spirited pair meet by chance, they soon form an unlikely relationship that will teach them to trust and love again, and may change their lives forever.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: Set against the backdrop of an international finance deal in New York and Peru, 'The Deal' is an intense political drama which explores how far people will go to get what they want.

programme.title: Black or White
programme.desc: Black or White is the story of a grandfather who is suddenly left to care for his beloved granddaughter. When her paternal grandmother seeks custody with the help of her brother, the little girl is torn between two families who love her deeply. With the best intentions at heart, both families fight for what they feel is right and are soon forced to confront their true feelings about race, forgiveness and understanding. Anchored by an all-star cast and inspired by true events, Black or White is a look at two seemingly different worlds, in which nothing is as simple as black or white.

programme.title: The Free World
programme.desc: Mo Lundy (Boyd Holbrook) is an innocent man who went to prison for a murder he did not commit. Once freed, Mo looks to put the past behind him by working in a shelter caring for abandoned animals, finding peace in the encouragement from his boss, Linda (Academy Award Winner Octavia Spencer: The Help), and faith in the practice of Islam. However, Mo's tenuous stability is again upended when a desperate and blood-soaked woman, Doris (Elisabeth Moss: TV’s The Handmaid’s Tale) turns up unexpectedly at his work one night.

programme.title: Big Sky
programme.desc: Hazel (Bella Thorne) suffers from a crippling case of agoraphobia. So much so that it causes a rift between her and her mother, Dee (Kyra Sedgwick). Hazel and her mother decide to go on a road trip to a desert facility to help Hazel deal with her fear, but when gunmen and brothers Jesse (Frank Grillo) and Pru (Aaron Tveit) attack them, Hazel has to battle her fears so she and her mother can survive.

programme.title: Mortdecai
programme.desc: Juggling some angry Russians, the British Mi5, his impossibly leggy wife and an international terrorist, debonair art dealer and part time rogue Charlie Mortdecai (Johnny Depp) must traverse the globe armed only with his good looks and special charm in a race to recover a stolen painting rumored to contain the code to a lost bank account filled with Nazi gold.

programme.title: Dark Minds
programme.desc: A twisted psychological thriller about a man haunted by his past. After Josh (Zachary Quinto – 'Star Trek') experiences a series of hallucinations involving his brother (Jon Hamm – 'Baby Driver'), he places himself in the care of a young therapist Emily (Jenny Slate – 'Obvious Child'). As Emily is forced to wade deeper and deeper into Josh’s psyche, she fights to discover the truth.

programme.title: 16 Blocks
programme.desc: They chose the worst man for the job. They expected him to fail, but he wasn't about to let a witness be murdered on his watch. Personal demons put Jack (Bruce Willis - Die Hard, Anti-Life) a New York City cop at rock bottom. But when he's assigned to escort a petty criminal to testify before the grand jury, a violent turn of events means this down-and-out cop needs to pull it together to save not only the life of the witness but his own as they are hunted across the city. The clock is ticking in this exhilarating race against time. Will justice be served or will there be two more bodies to add to the crime toll of the city?

programme.title: Invasion Planet Earth
programme.desc: After the death of his young daughter, Tom Dunn is a broken man. When his wife falls pregnant again, he cannot believe their luck. However, his joy is short-lived, as, on the very same day, the people of Earth become plagued with terrifying visions of the end of the world. When a gigantic, all-consuming alien mothership appears in the sky and launches a ruthless attack on Earth's cities, chaos and destruction follow. Tom must find the strength and wisdom to save his wife and unborn child. However, first he must confront a shocking truth. A truth which threatens the key to the survival of the human race. The ultimate war for Planet Earth is about to begin...

programme.title: Gutshot Straight
programme.desc: A professional poker player falls deep into the underworld when he takes an unexpected wager from a mysterious high roller. In order to protect himself and his family, he must try and get to the truth as he’s forced into a murder plot making him the prime target for revenge. This action thriller’s star cast includes George Eads (TV's CSI), AnnaLynne McCord (TV's 90210), Steven Seagal (A Good Man, Hard to Kill), Vinnie Jones (Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, Snatch), Stephen Lang (Avatar), Tia Carrere (Wayne’s World, True Lies) and Ted Levine (American Gangster, Shutter Island).

programme.title: Meet the Firm: Revenge in Rio
programme.desc: On the hunt for the Russian mobsters that murdered their best friend, football hooligans turned career-criminals, Mike and Eddie are led to Brazil where a major drug deal is set to take place under the cover of the World Cup. Looking to hijack the deal and gain the ultimate redemption, the pair become caught between international drug cartels, local thugs and corrupt police.
